summary: This document contains notes prepared by David Rodgers for trial testimony, detailing his recollections about Jeffrey Epstein's residences, flight manifests, travel to TVC, and instructions from Epstein's lawyers regarding passenger logs. It appears to be preparation material for legal proceedings.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Individual preparing testimony notes, recalling details about Epstein's residences, flight manifests, travel, and instructions from Epstein's lawyers.

connections.description: David Rodgers handled flight manifests for JE's planes and followed instructions from JE's lawyers regarding passenger logs.
David Rodgers visited GM's residence, indicating some level of acquaintance or connection.

events.title: Flight manifests handed over
events.description: David Rodgers gave all flight manifests for JE's planes in his possession to JE's attorney.

events.title: Travel to TVC
events.description: David Rodgers recalls flying JE to TVC (likely Traverse City, Michigan) between 1991 and 1999, around July/August.

events.title: Stop recording passengers
events.description: David Rodgers stopped recording passengers in his log book because one of JE's lawyers told him to stop.

locations: Large apartment on 59th Street near Columbus Circle
keyFacts: David Rodgers gave all flight manifests for Jeffrey Epstein's planes to Epstein's attorney around 2005 and did not keep copies.
Rodgers stopped recording passengers in his log book in February 2007 on instructions from one of Epstein's lawyers.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
